(Sorry this took so long! I've been Christmas shopping for about 20 people, 
thank the matrix for dollar stores... Anywho, I should be able to post more 
often now. With the break coming up, my teacher's have decided to let up on 
the work. I sense an ulterior, motive, but hey, as long as I don't haveta 
write another essay! Oh, I'm going to reactivate my other char, Hysteria. 
I'll probably post with her tomorrow. I'll post now^_^)

Rion bounded over the sand dune, and slide, head first, down the other side. 
After a few moments of coughing and rubbing his eyes he stood, and gasped. 
There, laying right infront of him, was a small leopard with little wings. 
She was surrounded by large birds. They had wings like his, that would 
explain his abnormal beast mode. He was a fuzor, it just wasn't very 
noticible!

Rion raised his wrist cannon and fired at the large circle of birds:

"Get away from he- Aaahhhhh!" The recoil sent Rion flying back against the 
sand dune. He landed with a thud. He sat up and looked behind him at the 
mess of feathers that lay around him. He quickly righted himself, drew his 
sword, and chraged the few remaining birds:

"Leave her alone!"

He swung wildly at them. He wouldn't have hit the broad side of the CF, but 
at least he was trying.

>* The birds kept coming in, investigating her until a swipe from her paw
>sent them back a few feet, but moments later were back again.
>< Stupid birds!> Diana thought as she swatted at another one, which came 
>too
>close.
>Too tired and hot to run, she sat there and batted at the buzzards, getting
>the occasional peck on the leg.
>Too young to know how to use her scanners, she didn�t know that help was
>just around the corner,
>But now the vultures were beginning to go behind her where she couldn�t 
>swat
>at them enough, striking out hard and fast. Pecking her back and hind legs.
>Diana tried to get at them, but every time she tried to turn around to get
>them they stepped back and squawked at her.
>But finally, nearly 20 min of fighting off the huge birds, Diana collapsed
>with a plaintive mew, unable to get her legs to keep her up anymore.
>
>The huge vultures finally moved in now, causally and slowly. Circling the
>lump of wheezing fur and occasionally pecking at it with their sharp beaks,
>a mew replying every strike.*
